metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5237 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
protobuf allows remote authenticated attackers to cause a heap-based buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2015-5237` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

elpa-protobuf-mode - 3.12.4-1ubuntu3
libprotobuf-java - 3.12.4-1ubuntu3
libprotobuf-lite23 - 3.12.4-1ubuntu3
libprotobuf23 - 3.12.4-1ubuntu3
libprotoc23 - 3.12.4-1ubuntu3
protobuf-compiler - 3.12.4-1ubuntu3
python3-protobuf - 3.12.4-1ubuntu3
ruby-google-protobuf - 3.12.4-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> since the message parsing limit defaults to 64 megabytes a software author would have to change the limit in order to handle larger messages anyway, and is thus unlikely to generate these messages in the short-term. (There is no actual limit on generation, so this might be an issue today -- it is just not a priority for the maintainer.) mdeslaur> per upstream bug, this was fixed in 3.4.0

criterions.comment: protobuf package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.12.4-1ubuntu3').
